newsitem.title: USA: Fleet, Dreyfus sue Middlesex County, Mass. - paper.
newsitem.headline: Fleet, Dreyfus sue Middlesex County, Mass. - paper.

text.p: Fleet Financial and Dreyfus Group, part of Mellon Bank, jointly sued Middlesex County, Mass., in an effort to recover about $4.7 million of debt, the Boston Globe said on Wednesday.
The Middlesex Commissioner told the Globe that he hoped legislative aid--loan guarantees--would let the county issue new bonds to pay off its creditors.
The state emergency board last Friday refused to allow the county to borrow more money, saying it lacked a detailed financial plan.
Officials with the firms and the county could not be reached for immediate comment by Reuters.
The county on Friday defaulted on $4.5 million of general obligations owned by the banks, which are seeking to get repaid for the notes plus interest.

A Middlesex Superior Court judge late Tuesday ruled in favor of the creditors, ordering that proceeds from the pending sale of a troubled hospital be put in escrow until various creditors' claims are sorted out, the Globe said.
Middlesex County Hospital, which is being sold to Olympus Healthcare Group for $4.4 million, owes its creditors around $19 million.
The sale to the for-profit company is expected to close around the end of the month, the company told the paper.
